The loom and the lugger. In two parts -- v. 7. Sowers not reapers. Cinnamon and pearls. A tale of the Tyne -- v. 8. Briery Creek. The three ages -- v. 9. The Farrers of Budge-row. The moral of many fables

With half-titles in each volume: "Tales of my landlord, third series." On the half-title verso for v. 1-2 is found a quotation from "Don Quixote" together with a translation; this is also found in some versions of v. 3-4, but alternatively on the half-title verso for v. 3 an advertisement for "Illustrations of the novels and tales of the author of Waverly." and for v. 4 an advertisement for "Memoirs of the most renowned James Graham, Marquis of Montrose." may be found
